parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: (a) I remain, tarry, (b) I remain in, persist in. From epi and meno; to stay over, i.e. Remain.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pleion; to do, make or be more, i.e. Increase; by extension, to superabound.
